misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that using System.out.print() to display a prompt and then subsequently printing data will automatically appear on separate lines, or that input reading implicitly adds a newline to the output stream.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: In Java, System.out.print() does NOT add a newline. When Scanner.nextInt() reads input, it only consumes the numeric token and leaves the input stream cursor after the number. The first subsequent print statement will appear on the same line as the prompt. The student did not recognize that a System.out.println() call needs to occur AFTER the prompt and BEFORE the triangle output to separate them visually.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: Wrong output: the first asterisk appears on the same line as the prompt ('Enter height: *' instead of the prompt on one line and '*' on the next)
